data.name: Espresso Stout
data.description: Starting its life as Sweet Devil Stout, then infused with fresh ground Italian espresso beans.  The coffee hits you right away, and is a dominate characteristic of this beer.  If you're feeling a bit sleepy or just want to start the day off right, Grab an Espresso Stout and get moving!

available.name: Limited
available.description: Limited availability.

style.name: Coffee-Flavored Beer
style.description: Coffee beers use coffee in any of its forms other than or in addition to hops to create a distinct (ranging from subtle to intense) character. Under hopping allows coffee to contribute to the flavor profile while not becoming excessively bitter. If this beer is a classic style with coffee flavor, the brewer should specify the classic style.

breweries.name: College Street Brewhouse & Pub
breweries.description: Just a quick drive to the north side of town, you'll find yourself at Havasu's hippest new brewhouse and pub. Here we focus on creating one-of-a-kind handcrafted beers. Revelers will appreciate sipping a smooth, flavorful craft brew while enjoying our rustic cuisine. Our casual atmosphere, outdoor dining, large bar and views of Lake Havasu are sure to become your favorite place to come and unwind.

data.name: EspressOat
data.description: A healthy amount flaked oats pair with English roasted malts give to give this beer a chocolatey flavor and silky texture but the star of the show is the nutty and welcoming coffee aroma and flavor from the infusion of locally roasted Balinese coffee (Isabella Imports, Galena).

style.name: Coffee-Flavored Beer

If this beer is a classic style with coffee flavor, the brewer should specify the classic style.

data.name: ESSEX BEAST
data.description: Folklore tells of many mythical creatures in all corners of the globe, from the Yeti of the Himalayas and the Sasquatch in the forests of North America, to the Loch Ness Monster and Beast of Bodmin Moor a little closer to home for example. The South East of England really does have its own legendary monster, the powerful Essex Beast! A gargantuan Porter crafted from a fine blend of pale, chocolate and dark crystal malts. Luscious aroma's gather to give wonderful toffee and coffee nose, the palate is full and complex with a spicy hoppiness followed by more treacle and mocha flavours. If encountered, don't be afraid to confront but please handle the Beast with care!

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

data.name: Excursion Coffee Stout
data.description: Dry Irish Oatmeal Stout brewed with cold pressed organic Carrabassett Coffee.  Rich and roasty.  Brewed with floor malted Maris Otter barley from the UK for a full malt character.  Flaked oats from Maine Grains enhance the creamy mouth feel.  Kent Golding hops from the UK give balance.

style.name: Coffee-Flavored Beer

Under hopping allows coffee to contribute to the flavor profile while not becoming excessively bitter. If this beer is a classic style with coffee flavor, the brewer should specify the classic style.

breweries.name: Orono Brewing Company
breweries.description: We love beer.  We believe in paying attention to every detail, no matter how small, to create the best possible beer we can brew.  It all starts with Brewmaster Asa Marsh-Sachs and his passion for brewing.  He brews with super filtered water, great malts such as floor malted Maris Otter, and hops from all over the world.  We don’t shy away from paying a bit more for exactly what we want, like the Mosaic hop in the Lightning Tree IPA.  Asa ferments the beer using a variety of different yeast strains to keep each beer tasting unique, and he filters all the ales except the Witbier.  Our custom built stainless steel glycol-jacketed brewery helps Asa get the results that he wants.  We sell over 95% of our beer by the pint or growler at the brewery and by the pint at Woodman’s.

breweries.description: Brewpub in the heart of Marin County.

data.name: Fate Scottsdale Coffee Pale Ale
data.description: American Pale Ale brewed with cold extracted coffee which imparts a rich coffee taste.  Copper in color.  Lots of coffee and citrus notes in aroma.  Bitter and hoppy finish.

breweries.name: Fate Brewing Company
breweries.description: We do things a bit differently at Fate. Our beers are brewed in small batches, which means you'll find steadily rotating traditional favorites, experimentals, seasonals and cask conditioned ales on tap exclusively at the brewpub. At Fate you'll be offered a nifty opportunity to develop and expand your taste profile with our ever changing distinctive beers and wood-fired pizzas. Join us for a pint and a pie at Scottsdale's very own micro brewpub and put Fate in your hands!

data.name: First Shift Coffee Porter
data.description: Need something to bring you out of that long winter hibernation? Java junkies rejoice your beer is here! Our First Shift Coffee porter is a robust porter full of deep malty chocolateness , that features a huge coffee aroma and Flavor. Aged on dark French roast for five months, this brew is sure to put some pep in your step!

breweries.name: Morgantown Brewing Company
breweries.description: Morgantown's oldest and newest brewpub, located in the heart of downtown Morgantown West Virginia. This casual local pub offers a wide range of craft beers brewed on the premises, great food, a live music venue and full calendar of events.   Meet friends for lunch or dinner, or have a beer and watch the big game on TV.  A must visit for craft beer lovers.

data.name: French Quarter Temptress
data.description: You don't have to hitch a ride to N'awlins for some Crescent City flavor. Our friends at Noble Coyote Coffee Roasters age green, Fair-Trade Certified™ Peruvian Cajamarca coffee beans in recently emptied bourbon barrels for months, then roast them to perfection. We slowly infuse the beans into our beer with a touch of chicory. You'll taste rich coffee, a hint of spice, and Fat Tuesday.

breweries.name: Lakewood Brewing Company
breweries.description:
From our origins home brewing out of a garage in the east Dallas neighborhood of Lakewood, to quickly becoming one of the fastest growing craft breweries in North Texas, we stay true to our vision of local beer for local folks. We're dedicated to using the highest quality ingredients to produce internationally inspired and locally crafted beers, perfect for whichever neighborhood you call home.
Pay us a visit in our taproom and beer garden. Brewery tours are offered on the weekends and free to the public. Schol!

data.name: Global Mutt Baltic Porter
data.description: Coffee Baltic Porter. European dark specialty malts. American hops. Bavarian lager yeast. Brazilian Coffee. Democratic Republic of Congo cocoa nibs. Washington chocolate. Deep dark opaque brown in color. Rich and full mouth feel. Tasting notes: coffee, chocolate, smooth, robust.

breweries.description: Wander Brewing is a production craft brewery located in Bellingham, WA. Wander was created to produce both traditional and innovative ales and lagers while maintaining our commitment to sustainable practices in our community.

data.name: Grace Anne Stout
data.description: Strong flavor of dark chocolate and french roasted coffee make this one perfect to chew. Dark and delicious!

breweries.name: Bitter Ester's Brewhouse
breweries.description: We are a Small Artisan Nano-Brewery!  We specialize in English inspired American Ales and Belgian-style Farmhouse Ales.  We use only the finest barley, grown and malted all over the world.  We use hops that are grown all over the world as well.  If you are noticing a theme our beers are unique to each time we brew therefore we need to tap the expert farmers and craftsman worldwide to get these wonderful and unique ingredients.  We have six ales on draft at any one time and our Dry stout and Brown Ale are the only reoccurring beers.  We brew farmhouse ales that are different every batch we brew.

data.name: Graveyard Shift
data.description: This collaboration with Chicago-based roasters, Dark Matter Coffee, creates a refreshing pale ale tirelessly infused with coffee. Two additions of the Mexico-grown light roasted "El Eden" bean were added post-fermentation, creating a strong coffee aroma and flavor without compromising the amazing light color of this beer.

style.name: Coffee-Flavored Beer
style.description: Coffee beers use coffee in any of its forms other than or in addition to hops to create a distinct (ranging from subtle to intense) character. Under hopping allows coffee to contribute to the flavor profile while not becoming excessively bitter. If this beer is a classic style with coffee flavor, the brewer should specify the classic style.

breweries.name: Arcade Brewery
breweries.description:
Arcade Brewery is a prospective production brewery. We want to create a deeper connection between our customers and their beer. Our goal is to create amazingly delicious craft beer with the help of our customers. With design challenges posted on our website, our customers will create and choose most aspects of beer creation from packaging/label design to even the ingredients that go into some of our seasonal beers. We want our customers to have greater control over the beer that they drink. Plus, we like to have fun and want to deliver you an amazing experience through your beer.

Arcade Brewery is also collaborating with amazing comic book artists and writers to bring label and packaging design to a whole new level of awesomeness. We are currently working with the talented Tony Moore (The Walking Dead), Eisner-nominated writer Jason Aaron (Scalped, Wolverine, PunisherMAX), and graphic artist Seibei.
Arcade Brewery is fun. We don’t believe in pretentious brews, but we do believe in great beers that satisfy our customers educated palette. 

Arcade Brewery is only limited to your imagination. Make the next beer your beer.

data.name: Happy Dog Coffee Porter
data.description: Green Tree Coffee used to be our neighbors, thankfully they are not far away now. We use their hand roasted coffee combined with the Wrecking Ball Baltic Porter to create this beer.

We have 17 draft lines dedicated to our beers. Some beers are brewed seasonally, but we try to keep different brews coming in all the time.

Marshall Wharf is the house brewery for Three Tides.

data.name: Hazy Morning
data.description: American medium bodied oatmeal stout hopped heavily with Centennial and Northern Brewer. Aged post fermentation with a custom and locally roasted coffee bean. Originally served via nitrogen draft system.

breweries.name: Apple Blossom Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Named after the Arkansas state flower, this 8,500 square foot, 250 seat brewpub is the largest in the state!

12 taps flow with craft beer all made on premises in our 10 barrel brewhouse. Styles vary from the classic, such as our flagship, Armstrong American Pale Ale, to current trends, such as our Mockingbird Black IPA, to the experimental, like our Sturdy Hippie IPA, fermented with a 14 year old sourdough strain belonging to our Executive Pastry Chef, Cody Johnson!
Speaking of Cody, he provides fresh baked bread in-house every day! From the sandwiches to the bread pudding and other amazing desserts, you can find his genius all over our menu and you can also find his bread for sale at Ozark Natural Foods for a taste of Apple Blossom at home! 
Our menu consists of affordable, amazing classics, such as the Cubano, Bahn Mi, or French Dip! We make all our soups, salad dressings, and all our prime rib is prepared in house! Our fries are cut fresh every day and fried to order! Try them topped with queso and some of the Mole chicken! And be sure to ask your server for the special of the day, as the kitchen is always encouraged to experiment and provide something new to pair with our beer.
And why not get a growler of your favorite beer to go? We offer both 64oz and 32oz!

Can't decide which beer is your favorite? Why not try a partial or full flight to get a sample of every brew we have to offer!
If beer's not your thing, we have a full bar and wine list, with special cocktails designed by our bartenders & owners! Cheers!
We have a private room that's available for meetings, parties, and weddings! Rent the whole place out and really show Fayetteville what a birthday party looks like!

Contact management@appleblossombrewing.com for details, questions, concerns, and complaints!

You can also find us on:
Twitter: @ABBCBeer
Instagram: @appleblossombrewing
Untappd: Apple Blossom Brewing Co. 

We've had the privilege of working with students from the UofA on a commercial! Check it out!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sHCrKs9EU3I

breweries.name: Coppertail Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Coppertail Brewing Co is a production brewery and taproom in progress scheduled to open in Tampa in late 2013. It was started by local home brewers and craft beer enthusiasts, Kent Bailey and Robb Larson. Brewmaster is Casey Hughes.

data.name: House United Coffee Stout
data.description: Our house specialty brew unites our two in house features, fresh roasted coffee and great craft beer. Brewed with six specialty malts and a light touch of lactose sugar at the end of the boil, our House United Stout is a rich, complex beer with a subtle sweetness and a big coffee nose and finish. We carbonate this one with a special gas blend that gives House United Stout a decadent velvety texture.

breweries.name: Red Horn Coffee House & Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Located in Cedar Park, Texas, Red Horn Coffee House and Brewing Co. offers fresh house roasted coffees and house brewed beer. With a focus on supporting other local artisans, Red Horn also offers locally sourced baked goods, charcuterie, cheeses, sodas, kombucha, wine, and a variety of sandwiches, salads and other artisan coffee and craft beer. Whether it’s sitting at the bar, lounging on a couch, or listening to local live music, our atmosphere is laid back and inviting. Come hang out with us.

breweries.name: Off Color Brewing
breweries.description:
We make beer. Sometimes we do other things but not as well.

We've produced award winning, beers on the global stage. Now we just do it for ourselves applying our brewing knowledge, experience, and creativity to create a new breed of classically inspired American beer.

data.name: I Hate My Boss Coffee Stout
data.nameDisplay: I Hate My Boss Coffee Stout
data.description:
Don't fight it, Spite It!

Cheers to the boss that made you feel like calling in sick every day.

The boss who is always on a power trip.

The boss who expects you there ten minutes early and shows up an hour late.

The boss who drives a Maserati while you take the bus.

This Coffee Stout, brewed with Mexican Santa Teresa coffee beans

from Halfwit roasters is here to help get you through the day

without telling your boss to go F himself.

breweries.name: Spiteful Brewing
breweries.description: We are a Chicago nanobrewery committed to brewing proper beer and delivering it to Chicagoans one case at a time.  We brew on a 3.5 bbl brew house and offer 12oz cans in 6 Packs, 16oz cans in 4 Packs, and 22oz bombers.  A few kegs pop up in town as well.

data.name: Imperial Java Stout
data.description:
This is the kind of beer that gives the word "Stout" a reputation. Generous quantities of Barley Malt, followed by a vigorous fermentation leaves this "Imperial" heavy weight with an 8% and a body as full as chocolate bread pudding. A complimentary and complex array of bitter notes comes from potent American hops, earthy Brittish hops, black-roasted malts and, of course, coffee.

We use only top-quality ingredients like organically grown East Timor coffee beans, blended with New Guinea coffee beans, and locally roasted by O'horis coffee house. It's heavenly aroma and flavor can't be beat or imitated.

breweries.name: Castle Danger Brewery
breweries.description: Castle Danger Brewery is a one-man production brewery located in Castle Danger, Minnesota, 12 miles northeast of Two Harbors off of Highway 61 at Castle Haven Cabins resort.  Clint & Jamie MacFarlane started the brewery journey in March 2010.  Clint brewed his first batch of beer on March 1, 2011.  His love of homebrewing finally turned into a dream-come-true.  He is brewing beer that he loves and knows others will enjoy, too.

data.name: Infusion A - Coffee Porter
data.description: Infusion A starts with the base of our Silk Porter and adds to its deliciousness with tasty swirls of chocolate and peanut butter flavor!

breweries.name: Hoppin' Frog Brewery
breweries.description:
Hoppin’ Frog is a small, hands-on brewery making very flavorful beers in the most flavorful beer styles. We brew high quality beers with an uncompromising focus on detail, from the ingredient selection to the brewing process. A specially designed JV Northwest brewing system creates more flavorful beers by allowing more barley to be used in the brewing process.  We also use a special bottling machine that keeps the beer fresher, and extends storage times compared to other conventional microbrewery bottling machines. This is very beneficial to retain all the character of these flavorful styles of beer.

Hoppin’ Frog is the concept of owner and established brewmaster Fred Karm, who has designed and produced more award-winning beers than any other professional brewer in Ohio since 2000. All of these awards were won at the 2 most prestigious contests in the world, including the Great American Beer Festival and the World Beer Cup. Mr. Karm has been a brewer of specialty beers since 1994, a life-long Akron, Ohio resident, and is a graduate of the University Of Akron.

locations.name: The Tasting Room at Hoppin' Frog

breweries.name: Brooklyn Brewery
breweries.description: Since its founding in 1988, The Brooklyn Brewery brews flavorful beers that enrich the life, tradition and culture of the communities it serves. Its award-winning roster of year round, season and specialty products have gained the Brewery notoriety as one of the top craft beer producers in the world. Brooklyn beers are currently distributed in 25 states and 17 countries, and throughout 2011 the brewery underwent an expansion that will double overall capacity by 2013. In addition to facilitating community meetings at its event space, brewery employees serve on not-for-profit boards, including the Prospect Park Alliance, the Open Space Alliance, Transportation Alternatives and the Brooklyn Historical Society. Each year the company supports many charitable and arts organizations including BAM, Brooklyn Museum and MoMA, and partners with food purveyors across the country to produce beer dinners and tasting events. The Brewery is open to the public Monday-Thursday from 5-7pm for reservation-only Small Batch tours, Friday evening for Happy Hour, and Saturdays and Sundays for Tours and Tastings. For more info, visit BrooklynBrewery.com and follow @BrooklynBrewery on Twitter.

data.name: Java Head Stout
data.description: JavaHead is based off of our original 2005 oatmeal stout. After the boil the hot wort passes through our hopback vessel packed full of whole leaf hops and a bed of coffee beans - akin to a French press - intensifying the coffee nose and releasing hints of coffee flavor. The result is a lush oatmeal mouthfeel balanced with cocoa, roast and subtle coffee flavors.

breweries.name: Tröegs Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Tröegs Brewing Company was established in 1997 by brothers Chris and John Trogner. Since then, the Central PA natives have been handcrafting world-class beers that blend traditional brewing techniques with the innovation and eclecticism of the American craft brewing movement. Today, the Hershey, PA-based brewery produces six year-round beers (Hopback Amber Ale, Troegenator Double Bock, JavaHead Stout, Tröegs Pale Ale, DreamWeaver Wheat, and Perpetual IPA); four seasonal releases as part of the Hop Cycle series (Cultivator Helles Bock, Sunshine Pils, Hop Knife Harvest Ale, and Blizzard of Hops Winter IPA); and two limited beers (Nugget Nectar and Mad Elf Ale). 

In addition to these beers, Tröegs produces a variety of experimental, small batch beers as part of its Scratch Beer Series. These beers are available exclusively at the brewery and most are draft-only limited releases, although some popular Scratch Beers (Fresh Hop Ale, Fest Lager, etc.) are bottled for release through the General Store at the brewery. 

In late 2013, Tröegs introduced a special line of cork & cage bottle releases. The first, LaGrave, is available year-round. Master of Pumpkins was also released in 2013 and will continue with availability in the fall. Other beers such as Jovial have since followed suit. The addition of a canning line not only offers the brewery more flexibility in the way it presents its beers, but also allows Tröegs to provide customers with more packaging options. To date, Tröegs has released Perpetual IPA and Sunshine Pils in 12-ounce cans and Troegenator in 16-ounce cans. Plans to release other seasonal and limited beers in cans are currently in the works. 

The Splinter Series is an extremely limited line of barrel-aged beers packaged in cork & cage bottles. While only a handful of these beers have been produced, Tröegs plans to expand this series with the inclusion of Nebulous (barrel-aged LaGrave with Brett), bourbon barrel-aged Troegenator, and others. 

Tröegs currently distributes its beers throughout Delaware, Massachusetts, Maryland, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Virginia and Washington D.C. In addition, Tröegs plans to expand into other New England markets in 2015.

Our state-of-the-art facility gives visitors a glimpse into the workings of a full production brewery by offering both guided tasting and self-guided tours. Our Tasting Room provides ample seating with views of the brewhouse, where you can sit back and enjoy one of our six year-round beers as well as a variety of seasonal and small-batch experimental brews. 

Our Snack Bar reflects our constant desire to explore, discover and share by focusing on fresh, simple fare that is locally sourced and house-made. With that in mind, we feature a seasonally rotating menu with daily chef’s specials.

www.troegs.com

breweries.name: Fat Bottom Brewing
breweries.description:
Fat Bottom’s full-flavored brews are bigger and more exciting than other beers in town. Our signature brews represent a sophisticated array of styles perfected over many years, with a few unique twists. Ben has refined each recipe and sourced the highest quality ingredients for every batch of specially crafted Fat Bottom beer.

Our beer is unfiltered, so you can savor the unique cloudy appearance and subtle flavors that truly bring craft beer to life. We like the bolder hops flavors, distinct body of aromas, and the beautiful color compounds that come from the natural grains. Unfiltered beers also have more nutrients from yeast and barley malt, including B vitamins which have been shown to reduce the effects of hangovers… a little added benefit for those of us who seriously love beer.

data.name: Java Mac
data.description:
Java Mac is our most popular coffee beer, a version of our Wee Mac Scottish-Style Ale infused with coffee from local Indianapolis' roasters BJava Coffee and Tea.
 
Java Mac was the winner of the Gold Medal in the Coffee Beer category at the 2011 Great American Beer Festival.

breweries.name: Sun King Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Sun King Brewing Company is an Indianapolis-based craft brewery with a focus on continually creating traditional seasonal and unique specialty beers. 

Sun King rolled its first keg of beer out the door in July 2009 and since that time has grown into the second largest brewery in Indiana, producing over 27,000 barrels of beer in 2014 while selling all of it in Indiana. Sun King's beers have been awarded multiple medals at the Great American Beer Festival and World Beer Cup.

Located in a downtown Indianapolis warehouse, Sun King was the first full-scale production brewery in Indianapolis since 1948. Sun King beer can be enjoyed at fine bars/restaurants and liquor stores throughout Indiana or in their Tasting Room, located in the brewery at 135 N. College Avenue.

breweries.name: Blind Tiger Brewery & Restaurant
breweries.description:
We opened the first brewery in Topeka since the Prohibition era. 
It is named after the Prohibition era custom of displaying stuffed tigers in establishments to alert patrons of the availability of bootleg alcohol. These speakeasies were referred to as “Blind Tigers.”   We keep at least six flagships and seven rotating seasonals on tap, to the tune of about 1300 barrels a year. Our brews have gathered 21 national and international awards over the past 15 years.  Our Brewpub is located at 37th & South Kansas Avenue.

data.name: Java Stout
data.description: Saddlebock java stout starts with Saddlebock stout, then adds French Roast coffee during the brew process. The result is a balanced coffee note blended with the creamy flavor of our Saddlebock stout.

breweries.name: Saddlebock Brewery
breweries.description: Welcome to Saddlebock Brewery - the first production brewery in Northwest Arkansas. Since 2012, we've been brewing fine, European-style beers in an environmentally friendly facility. Saddlebock Brewery was named by Yahoo Travel as one of the coolest craft brewery tours in America, and Steve Rehbock, our founder, was recognized this year as an Arkansas Eco-Hero.

data.name: Joe Coffee Porter
data.description: Joe is not your average beer! This ale is brewed with locally-roasted, fair-trade, coffee. Dark Munich and chocolate malts combine to create a well-balanced, flavorful porter with a fresh roasted coffee aroma. Savor ’til the last drop!

breweries.name: Philadelphia Brewing Co
breweries.description: This is, Philadelphia's one and only Philadelphia Brewing Company; brewers of fine hand crafted Ales from our historic brewery building in the Kensington neighborhood of Philadelphia. Like the history of brewing in Philadelphia the name Philadelphia Brewing Company has gone through many revivals. The same can be said of our brewery building - the former Wiesbrod and Hess Brewing Company complex in Kensington. At Philadelphia Brewing Co we take pride in our brews, our people, and our community. One person could never do everything that it takes to get beer into your glass. And it may sound obvious, but we won't brew anything that we wouldn't drink ourselves - you won't catch us drinking anything called Ultra unless it's a literal name meaning more flavor, more hops, more malt, more carbs. That's because we are Brewers; proud brewers of fine hand crafted Ales from our historic brewery building in the Kensington neighborhood of Philadelphia. Now that's out of the way; we will be starting out with four mainstay brews which will be available in draught and in bottles. Once we're stocked up on the core brews we'll start pumping out regular seasonal or specialty brews. The specialty series will be driven by our individual brewers and the desires and whims of the rest of our family.  The beer is flowing at Philadelphia Brewing co! You can find our four brands on tap at finer establishments all around town!

Join us at our brewery and try as many as seven of our own beers including SOUTHY BITCH SLAP American Irish Red, BLUE COLLAR American Wheat, HOPCORE American Pale Ale or anything else we may be brewing at the time.

breweries.name: Custom Brewcrafters, Inc.
breweries.description:
Custom BrewCrafters introduced to the market in 1997 an innovative micro-brewing concept in which they have partnered with dozens of local restaurant and tavern owners in offering unique signature craft-brews custom designed for each establishment.

In addition to adding this new dimension to the Western New York beer market, Custom BrewCrafters opened a tasting room and gift shop at the brewery in Honeoye Falls, where we introduce the public to the many unique custom brews as well as educate them on craft beer and microbrewing.

data.name: Judge Roy Bean

This beer is our tribute to the beloved Eastern Shore landmark, and much like the old days at the Bean, we think you'll love spending your holiday with Judge Roy Bean.

breweries.name: Quest Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Quest Brewing Company officially started becoming a reality in January 2012.  That is when Don Richardson and Andrew Watts met for the first time; each with thoughts of opening up a microbrewery in Greenville, SC.  Both had put together plans for their company vision and, as luck would have it, those plans mirrored each other!  The two joined forces and Quest Brewing Company was founded.

Once the business was formed, a brewery name was needed.  After weeks of brainstorming, the name ‘Quest’ rose to the top of our list.  We wanted a name that emulates that passionate and adventurous spirit of the Greenville community.

”People in Greenville are always on some kind of quest.  Whether it is to bike the entire Swamp Rabbit Trail or hike Table Rock, there is a very adventurous spirit here.  We wanted to embrace that.” -Quest’s Andrew Watts

Quest’s beer is meant to be premium and sought-after, much like a goal or quest.  The next time you are in Greenville, make it your quest to visit all our town has to offer.  Head to Falls Park.  Enjoy Main Street.  Most importantly, enjoy one of Quest’s hand-crafted beers!

data.name: Kick Start Coffee Imperial Porter
data.description:
Deep, dark mahogany in color with a luscious tan head, our Imperial Coffee Porter boasts aromas of decadent chocolate and fresh coffee. An astoundingly rich malt explosion fused with sweet and nutty coffee flavor lays into the palate, leaving the taste buds clamorous for another sip. Medium carbonation and body conjoined with a clean and subtle hop character present a gratifying finish. Enjoy!
 
Malts: 2-row pale malt, Dark Munich 30, CaraAroma, Coffee (brown) Malt and Chocolate Rye
Bittering hops: Magnum and Hallertauer
Flavor Hops: Glacier
Finishing Hops: Glacier and Willamette
 
Morning Mayhem Coffee from Kinetic Coffee Co.
 
O.G. 1.080
F.G. 1.018
ABV 8.23%
ABW 6.4%
IBU 32.2
SRM 33.2

breweries.name: Mad River Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Mad River Brewing company is now in our third decade of operation and even now it is hard to think of what we do as a business and not as a hobby. Brewing is a passion here and we spend a great deal of our time trying to perfect the next great taste.
 
At Mad River Brewing company we pride ourselves on the fact we are still here because of you. Without your support and your love for our passion we would not have made it this far. We love to hear from you so if you have something you wish to say good or bad by all means send us an email.

breweries.name: Wynwood Brewing Company
breweries.description: Wynwood Brewing Company is Miami’s first craft production brewery in the heart of Wynwood Art District, featuring a tap room. We are family owned and operated with the simple objective of bringing fresh, delicious, and creative beers to thirsty South Floridians and tourists alike. We operate a 15-barrel brewhouse and distribute our blond ale, IPA, Porter, barrel aged Strong Ales and seasonal offerings.

data.name: Lariat Coffee Stout
data.description:
We make our Lariat Coffee Stout by adding Basecamp Espresso to our award-winning Hooligan Stout. 

The Basecamp Espresso is a smooth, rich, and balanced blend of four organic coffees from around the world specially roasted, blended, and brewed for us by Larait Coffee Roasters in Winthrop. Each coffee in this blend is individually roasted to preserve the unique flavor and aroma of each country of origin. This artisan blend is then slow-brewed to create a full-bodied, delicious complement to our Hooligan Stout.
